nodes.text: All of you did reasonably well on your safe test in our last class.
However, Herr O'Conner did not have the patience or the skill to master the art of disarming the trap upon the safe.
If Herr O'Conner thought he could get by in this class without applying himself to his lessons, he is mistaken.
I'm so sorry, Master. The trap was trickier than anything I have ever seen. I guess I just wasn't meant to be a Thief, but please, can I still be a Rogue?
You had better do very, very well on the final exam, Herr O'Conner, or you will find that you are unsuited to be either a Thief or a Rogue.
I begin to think that Mr. Terk's assessment of your abilities was accurate. Don't try my patience.
You see, Sir, it's like this...
Yesterday, just after dinner, I was walking past the Hall of Heroes when a Paladin student came up to me and asked if I could help her out.

She had been putting something back into one of the display cases in the Hall and accidentally locked her key in the case. I used my tools to open the case, but the gear pick became jammed and broke in pieces when I tried to get it out.
I immediately ran down to the store to buy a replacement, but Gregor was sleeping when I got there. I didn't want to disturb him, so I meant to come back the next day before class.

Unfortunately, my roommate needed to go to the infirmary before class so I didn't have a chance to replace my tool. So during the test, I ran down to the store. Unfortunately, Gregor was out of stock on his shelves for the Houdini and we had to search the storeroom for it.
By the time I got back, class was over, but I do have a new Houdini 42 now. I could take the test over.
You expect me to believe such a cockamamie concoction of lies? You need to make up better alibis the next time you screw up.
Not only did you fail to open a safe, you now waste my time with ridiculous lies.
If you don't do exceptionally well on the final exam, you will be neither a Rogue nor a Thief.

options.text: Confront Master von Urwald About the Matter

nodes.text: I want to be a Rogue, not a Thief. I saw no reason to waste your time watching me struggle with a lock, nor did you want to hear any excuses, so I just left.
That stunt you pulled with the safe test did not convince me you actually want to be a Rogue, Herr O'Conner.
You have one more chance to redeem yourself with the final exam - or you will be looking for a new career...
Perhaps as a Certified Public Accountant.
So you chose to be rude as well as incompetent with the safe test... Your future career as a Rogue seems extremely unlikely.
Clearly Conner doesn't deserve to be in this class, Master. He insults your excellent teaching methods by his failure.
Indeed.
The Final Exam of the semester will be given to you three days hence. I suggest you study and review all prior lessons for it.
As part of that exam, you will be asked to choose the person you think deserves the title of "Rogue of the Year."
I want you to think about this for the next few days.
Has anyone in this classroom gone out of his or her way to do things that made the school or your life a little better?
Rogue of the Year is not a popularity contest. It is a title earned by your actions in class and outside of it.
In addition, you will justify why you yourself deserve to win the title of 'Rogue of the Year'. What outstanding act of Roguery did you accomplish in the course of this semester?
Think about what positive difference have you made in the lives of those around you... Convince me that you deserve the title.
Are there any questions or comments?
If this isn't a popularity contest, Master, why are you asking for the biased opinions of the other students?
One of the most important skills for Rogues to develop is 'Charm.'
If you have not made friends of your classmates during the course of this semester, then you have missed a critical lesson of being a Rogue - friends are important.
Any other questions?
Will this Final Exam be multiple choice or an essay?
Yes.

options.text: Ask About the Rogue of the Year Award

nodes.text: So what is the point of the 'Rogue of the Year' contest? Do we get some sort of reward or something?

The winner of the award will get a trophy for the accomplishment and high evaluation marks for the final grades. The winner will also have the satisfaction of knowing that he or she is liked and respected by his or her peers.
What is the mean air speed of an unladen swallow?
Are there any other meaningful questions?
Very well - you are dismissed.
